title: Long Bridge No. 13
provenance_text:
Preben Hornung [1919-1989], Copenhagen, Denmark, until December 1952; G. David Thompson [1899-1965], Pittsburgh, PA, December 1952 until March 1954; his gift to Department of Fine Arts, Carnegie Institute, Pittsburgh, PA, March 1954 [3].

Notes:
[1]. The painting was no. 118 in "The 1952 Pittsburgh International Exhibition of Contemporary Paintings" held at Carnegie Institute, October-December 1952.
[2]. Mr. Thompson purchased the painting from the International for $200. Payment to the artist was made on December 11, 1952 and receipt was acknowledged on December 23, 1952.
[3]. The painting was received at the museum on September 30, 1953; it was accessioned on March 3, 1954.
